item.title: Report E-2025050162
item.description:
Report E-2025050162

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-09T12:25:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-10
  • City: SAINT PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from two (2) 1-gallon metal pails due to a forklift accident that resulted in the pails being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel did not need to deploy granular absorbents to the impacted area because the paint dried. They gathered the damaged pails and containerized them into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025040811
item.description:
Report X-2025040811

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-09T12:25:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-04
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED IRREG HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING A SMALL QUANTITY OF LIQUID AND EMITTING A GASOLINE-LIKE ODOR BY THE AREA SUPERVISOR AT DOOR 60 ON THE PD-1. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND CONTACTED THE DMP. WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED AND A 6 INCH RADIUS PUDDLE CLEANED UP, THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED A PUNCURE HOLE ON THE UPPER BODY OF A 1-GAL METAL CAN.

item.title: Report E-2025040188
item.description:
Report E-2025040188

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-12
  • City: SAINT PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to the drum being punctured during loading. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum along with PPE. One (1) 85-gallon metal drum was used to contain the damaged drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040119
item.description:
Report E-2025040119

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-15
  • City: Labadie
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE KIESEL CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 288295
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The driver exited Hwy MM, turning on Hwy T, the front right steer tire side wall ruptured, sending the truck into a 20' ditch. The tractor and trailer rolled on its side, slid across 2 more ditches and then the fifth wheel broke and the tractor continued sliding and came to rest in the final ditch. The 1st compartment of the trailer ruptured and approx 1,475 gallons of diesel fuel was released. The temperature was below freezing, the ditches were frozen and the red dye diesel stayed in the snow and on top of the ice. Kiesel sent a cleanup crew and vacuum trucks to empty the remaining contents of the trailer and vacuum up free liquids. The recovered materials were transported to the Kiesel terminal. Dams were created in the ditches under the oversight of the USEPA and Missouri Department of Natural Resources to prevent spread of contamination. When the snow melted, cleaning of the ditches commenced. All of the dams except for 1 have been removed and the cleanup is in its final stage. Contaminated soils have been excavated and transported to Waste Management Milam Landfill. All response operations performed with approval of USEPA.
